author: Bobby Quinn
title: Crowdsourced map imagery w/ paypixl
description: Mapping critical resources in growing regions is critical, but difficult to do without ground truth and location-based imagery.

assessments.note: This is a nice use case for Cardano in Africa and would drive usage of ADA

creates new jobs? Sure. But not so many IMO, and it is a long way to materialize the impact.

Cardano is considered the best public block-chain operating in Africa - 2/5
Cardano projects in Africa are not isolated but networked and growing 5/5

While the proposal would potentially increase usage and network effect of ADA, the proposer does not provide enough technical details or a concrete plan to realize the vision. The nature of the Cardano integration is unclear.

Up to date localised imagery is essential in the development of local communities. From urban planning, to medical emergencies, the needs are many. This proposal addresses a critical necessity in the African continent. Combined with the motivation of ADA rewards, this proposal has a very good purpose behind it.

May not be a walk up obvious proposal to grow Africa but certainly can play a part in helping new users become familiar with cardano. Well received by community in the comments and this suggests an interesting topic that has prompted interaction.

It would be good to have more information on how they will manage the launch in Afrcia. Which countries, how are the stakeholders who will pay, how are they going to connect with pilots. Is there a drone pilot community in Africa? If not how will they start one, fund purchase or rental of drones etc.
the proposer is stating enough eligible competence.

feasibility: 1/5
The proposer's experience is highly relevant to the project but they provide no means to verify this experience.  The relationship of the proposer to the paypixl project is unclear.  The propeser did not respond to community questions during the refine stage.

The team has proven that they have experience since the image collection platform is already up and running, offering a valuable service of on-demand drone imagery. Combined with on the ground imagery provided by anyone who joins the platform and is willing to travel to a specific location and take the required photographs, the project could produce valuable resources. Not only is their project well-written, but the information included sustains their plan of execution.

The proposer seems to have the required knowledge to further the proposal. I note PC community are linked and feel this will be essential for moving the project forward. The plan would benefit from further detail as it a little generic at this stage.

More information should be provided on how they are actually going to engage both sides of the market in Africa (pilots and images users). What are the funds going to be used for. It should be noted this proposer has also applied for funds in the metadata challenge.

no metrics provided, but:

Number of purely African participants  can be measured 5/5
Number of Outside African participants with a significant partnership with African residents can be measured 5/5
Feedback on progress from successful proposals regardless of failure or success not stated, yet I can not imagine it  1/5
Novelty and appropriateness of solutions (hard to quantify, easy to see) 1/5
Number of African Fund5 proposals that do not need further funding to keep operating 1/5

Auditability 1/5 
The proposer does not provide a breakdown of fund allocation, a timeline, or a clear picture of what success would look like. if the funds were delivered to the proposer, it would be very difficult to assess if they were put to productive use.

The proposal contains a lot of useful information, though neither in the project description, nor in the attached documents is there a detailed budget, metrics or roadmap to be found. The sum they are asking for seems reasonable, however, it would have been better to include some details regarding their plan of spending.

Overall a well produced proposal that will be improved by further refinement. The proposal has a key ingredient (mass appeal) that if designed correctly will grow not only Africa but locations everywhere. Still need to work out many aspects to  be fully accepted.

solution: paypixl assigns imagery collection tasks in areas needing mapping data to users with compatible devices and rewards users with ADA coin.
experience: 15 years aerial and satellite imagery acquisition, 7 years combined in blockchain, currently completing a Masters in Blockchain Technology
